alert.note: Alert for Branch (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:13PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Steuben, northeastern Lagrange and southwestern Branch Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lagrange, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Brief heavy downpours are also possible with this storm. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Steuben, northeastern Lagrange and southwestern Branch Counties, including the following locations... Stroh, Flint, Brighton, Mongo, Hudson, Lake Gauge, Nevada Mills, Brushy Prairie, Orland and Crooked Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 341 and 351. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 123 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
